headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: The Hague: Bosnian Serbs File Charges

lead_paragraph: The United Nations war crimes tribunal has received and will examine documents from Bosnian Serb authorities charging the former Bosnian president, Alija Izetbegovic, with war crimes. Mr. Izetbegovic, a Muslim who led the government during the 1992-95 Bosnian war, has not been accused of any crimes by the tribunal. In a separate case, a former vice admiral from Yugoslavia, Miodrag Jokic, pleaded not guilty to charges of war crimes in connection with the 1991 attack on the city of Dubrovnik in Croatia. Marlise Simons (NYT)
abstract: UN war crimes tribunal in the Hague receives and will examine documents from Bosnian Serb authorities charging former Bosnian president, Alija Izetbegovic, with war crimes (S)
